p: Although limitations of clinical studies require further confirmation, Ï‰-3 PUFA intake produced significant clinical benefits and reduction of the symptoms in patients with autoimmune disorders, especially rheumatic diseases and systemic lupus erythematosus [ 195, 196, 197]. In support, low levels of PUFAs have been found in the serum of patients with rheumatic diseases [ 198]. Conversely, inconsistent results are reported for multiple sclerosis, thus the possible usefulness of these fatty acids as supportive therapy requires more clinical trials [ 199].
